website_summaries.verdict: Simple way to remove corn from cob with an easy tube-shaped tool.
pros: Simply insert corn into tool, press and twist or push
Blades inside the ring do all the cutting for you
Some users say they can now de-kernel 3 cobs in under a minute
cons: Although manufacturers claim this works on "any size cob," a huge one won't fit it inside

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This gets stuck half way through if you have big ears of corn. Twisting the cob until it finally makes it through leaves corn going everywhere. Once the cob makes it through my hand holding the tool would shoot forward and slam into the bowl sending corn flying. I'm going back to using a knife. Put a small bowl upside down in a large bowl. Place the corn on the small bowl and run your knife down the side of the cob. Easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: McNystrom

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fast with little waste.
customer_reviews.text: We love BBQ corn. Not so much on the cob but stripped and put into salad. This does a much nicer job than just cutting with a knife. Here's a tip: use a bundt pan and put the base of the corn in the hole, then strip down from the top. The pan will catch the kernels and save a big cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kalman

customer_reviews.title: Not Good.
customer_reviews.text: They don't adjust to smaller or larger cobs. After using it I still ate much of the corn off of the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N.

customer_reviews.title: This stripper can't handle a big cob
customer_reviews.text: Meh....I thought this would be a wonderful gift for my Grandson who just got braces. The major problem must be our California Sweet Corn, The cobs are just too big. Secondly, the inner cutting ring bent out of shape on the first try - and the cutting teeth bent straight up. So using the old fashioned knife routine will have to do. Sending it back as soon as he gets it back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I stripped 15 ears of sweet corn in less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: To cob or not to cob? Corny, but so darn cool...lol!
customer_reviews.text: Well if you like corn on the cob and then off simply. This is an awesome tool to decorn your cob. When I first seen it, I thought this is way to simple looking to work, but soon I was amazed at how simple it was to work. Fresh corn off the cob simply! Just be careful about the heat of your corn, cause this is still hands on. Use a cloth or silicone to pull corn cob through. So nice without any waste of kernel either. Mmm mmm great!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Way To Remove Corn from the Cob
customer_reviews.text: I have been making creamed corn for years and the part I dread is using a knife to remove the cor kernels from the cob. It is almost impossible and you have to have some muscle behind the knife to really get the job done. With this tool anyone can easily remove corn from the cob in minutes! It is as easy as twisting the cob thru the device and the kernels just fall off the cob. It is the best tool in my kitchen and one I can't do without. If you like corn ....you have to have this !!
customer_reviews.author: Summergirl

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done quickly
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing I haven't used anything like this I used it of course to strip my corn and it was amazing a lot safer than trying to do it with a knife and table slipping all over the place and running the risk of slicing a finger or hand. It cleaned the cob even got the milk particles out from the kernel and was not that messy. Clean up with easy, hands cramped a little bit I did a whole bushel of corn at one time. Would recommend this product it saves time and mess and gets the job done quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne M Farnell

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use corn remover
customer_reviews.text: I thought this wasn't going to be good, but turns out it does its job really good. It's very sturdy and quickly gets the corn off the cob without any strength having to be used. Exactly what I needed for a much more cleaner way to eat corn for my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes Guzman

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased many tools to make stripping corn easier. This is the first that has delivered! It is so easy to use and makes it fast. I bought 60 ears of corn to freeze for the winter. This tool made it so much faster. I usually resort to a sharp knife, but not this time! It does require some arm strength- not a ton, but my arms did get tired by the end. But they have with every tool I’ve used, too. Love it! Well worth the $6 that I paid for it!
customer_reviews.author: stephen sutton

customer_reviews.title: A little awkward
customer_reviews.text: I like this stripper more than I do the kind with two handles. It seems sturdy and cleaned easily in the dishwasher. My biggest complaint would be the slight difficulty of pushing the cob all the way through. That was a minor inconvenience and realistically I don't know how I would design it better. I am glad I purchased this and it is definitely better than just using a knife.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrifically easy to use
customer_reviews.text: First twist or two will send some kernals flying but there after it does not. Terrifically easy to use. My husband can not eat corn on the cob but we all love it. So, the solutions over the years have never worked or were not strong enough to handle normal pressure of a human. This one however is great! Easy to store too.
customer_reviews.author: Nona McKeever

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really remove the whole kernel of corn. It leaves a fair amount on the cob. The "one size fits all" concept doesn't work too well here.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I had my engineer husband use this on our fresh corn on the cob. He wasn't thrilled and said the design flaw was that corn is not uniform size, making handling a hot corn on the cob unwieldy for a uniform-sized device that ends up being much more difficult than the traditional knife scraping. Unfortunately this item will now sit in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: marjorie

customer_reviews.title: Corn nibblets in seconds
customer_reviews.text: I literally stripped half a dozen ears of corn in ;less than two minutes. It seems very sturdy and I expect to get many (y)ears of service out of it. Nice find.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bunn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: What’s to say beyond the headline? Generally I hate single use kitchen item but even more than that is cutting corn off the cob for a recipe. This gadget does what it says and I’m glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Krienke

customer_reviews.title: Sized wrong- for tiny cob only!
customer_reviews.text: Cobs are generally larger than this allows. I should have returned it but missed the deadline. Skip this one, just seemed like good idea. Keep watching for a better product because this design has flaws.
customer_reviews.author: 211ssw

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use,glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I had an accident while I was young and haven't been able to bite into certain foods. I've been having to cut my corn on the cob off with a knife my entire life I finally found this in my 50s the best thing I've ever bought it takes just a few seconds to get all the kernels off without having to use a knife, the kernels can end up off the plate if you go too fast but slow down and they fall straight down, hard to clean the sharp points but well worth it
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Best $5 kitchen investment
customer_reviews.text: Im impressed. Arrived sooner than I thought being that it’s just days before Christmas. Expected amount of pressure needed to get the blades going then I would just twist making sure to not angle into the core. Took a few tries to not make a splattering mess. Maybe there was directions but I didn’t bother reading it. I’ve been wasting so much time and corn using a knife. I love this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Much easier then a knife! Hahaha
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I couldn't just slide it down the cob or it would cut into the cob itself. However if you twist it a little as you push the cob through it works perfect. I cut 24 cobs in about 10 minutes. Perfect for someone who cans or just can't cut with a knife anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen gadget ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this item. I have 2 false teeth and cannot eat corn on the cob. This makes cutting it off so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that this would be hard to use but it works great! Very easy and quick . I will now be making corn salsa with fresh corn💖
customer_reviews.author: S. PFEIFER

customer_reviews.title: Just use a knife. It works for a very ...
customer_reviews.text: Just use a knife. It works for a very specific subset of corn core sizes, which does not seem to encompass any of the cobs that I had. It's a silly invention for a problem that doesn't really exist unless you're an industrial factory.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great for corn lovers
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend can eat corn with every meal, and we cook it so often that I'd rather use this one than the old knife way and i feel its safer and i wont slip up and cut off a finger. I got it as a little gift for his birthday and is among our top regular kitchen gadget. Definitely a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: I wrote to this company and never heard back. this is a very cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky DD.

customer_reviews.title: It Takes all of your corn off the cob
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for this item for a while and believe me it works so good there is nothing left on the cob A good item
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: It works, just don't get burned.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a problem with corn flying everywhere. Quite the opposite. However, it did get stuck. The corn was hot, so I had to use paper towels to keep from getting burned. This thing did cut of a majority of the corn very neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Judith H. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not all corn cobbs are the same size
customer_reviews.text: Stick with the corn cutter that has a grooved boared with a blade in the middle- it may be old-school but it’s what works. This one does not. Different size cobbs make this impractical
customer_reviews.author: D. Ruhl

customer_reviews.title: Love this idea!!
customer_reviews.text: This was ok to use. Corn does fly everywhere. Maybe there’s a learning curve?? I haven’t perfected it yet. I love the idea and it’s easier then a knife to cut it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: his barely worked. Does not pull all the corn off. It def depends of what size con you have. if you have really thin corn it will not work. If you have to thick of corn it will not work either,. You have to have the perfect size corn for this to work. I would not buy this. Its a waste of money. wondering if I can return for my money back?
customer_reviews.author: Cristy S.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice but it did not work as well as I had hoped. I had mouth surgery and I cannot bite in to the corn so I was really looking forward to not using a knife to cut it off the cob. It kind of splattered corn across the countertop so I ended up making sure I use it on a big tray.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tool did amazing things at my house!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this item has done an amazing thing. My husband hates new fangled things and I never expected him to try this. I bought it for me to use. But when we bought a case of corn to "put up" my husband used it and loved it! I don't know, did you feel the Earth move?
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Great utensil
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy with this item, worked great!! Did find when getting to the larger bottom part of cob I could twist instead of pushing down to remove the corn!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: More dangerous than a usable kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: Blades are not sharp enough to do what they’re supposed to. And the cob has to be the exact right size or the tool is more useless. Much safer to use a knife instead of this. Worthless really so save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B Armentrout

customer_reviews.title: Um not soo good!
customer_reviews.text: Does well on half an ear of corn. Then you are stuck trying to finish the last 1/4 ear. Have cut myself more than once trying to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Walton

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and did not give it much thought. I have received this now and it is down right amazing. If you like fresh corn and want to get it off of the cob-do not hesitate-order it today. In fact, order two.
customer_reviews.author: PHYLLIS A LYNCH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing actually works like I saw it on TV. Easy to use, same results every time. The only issue you might have is the cob, depending on how you cook the corn and how long before using the Stripper, can be very hot to hold while using the product. Easier to use than a knife by far.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Romano

customer_reviews.title: One piece and easy clean up!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't thomk I would like it or be able to use it when I saw it's diameter compared to the large corn cobs I bought from the farm but it was easy to slide down and cut the kernels off. The blade is extremly sharp andvleans easy.
customer_reviews.author: SweetAlivia

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who wear braces!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves corn on the cob but when she got braces on, she couldn't no longer eat it. We got this so she could enjoy eating corn again. It works great. Easy to clean and easy for her to shuck her own corn. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AimHigh67

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow !!!!! It’s so easy to strip the kernels off with this product. It’s safer than a knife and a lot faster too!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but comes up short.
customer_reviews.text: If you have smaller cobs, this simply leaves too much on the cob. I did much better with a knife and didn't have as much waste.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Goodson

customer_reviews.title: To my surprise it was easy to use and stripped the corn off the cob ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had an accident with a knife earlier this year and did not want to risk another trip to the ER. I was a bit skeptical until I tried it. To my surprise it was easy to use and stripped the corn off the cob cleanly. It did get a little slippery after a few ears. I was not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: M. Thayer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This really works... It does exactly as t said. The corn is easily comes off the cob, with a push. It is a simple, straight forward product that works.
customer_reviews.author: Lawgo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I was NOT impressed-- what a waste of money-- I guess if all corn was thin and the same size it would BE great BUT it is NOT. It would only go down 1/2 way and it wastes a lot of corn then you have to use a knife to get the rest off. So i feel i waste my $$ WOULD not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: This is the one for me!
customer_reviews.text: First - due to MS I have only one usable hand. This stripper works perfectly. I'm up to, I think, 5 strippers now. This one sits on top of my pile.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Stagis

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: this thing is AWESOME. I have tried other corn strippers and this thing puts them all to shame. Just push through until you have a grip and then twist and pull. Best used with silicone oven gloves if the corn is still hot
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have the one that is alike a peeler and hated it! Ordered this one and love it! Feels so much safer to use!
customer_reviews.author: FORDF150

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: It works but it can be messy, however, my grandson was finally able to eat fresh corn with the family. I give it a thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Corntastic!
customer_reviews.text: My parents could not eat off the cob any longer and this is a great product and easy to use. It is nice for them to have some fresh corn and not out of a can.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom as she is 93 and cutting corn off the cob is difficult for her. This solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Brinkman

customer_reviews.title: Does not work very well
customer_reviews.text: This does not work as well as another one that I have. It doesn't adapt to the size of the ear of corn nor does it slide easily. I've only used it once and that may be the last time.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Big corn needed
customer_reviews.text: Works great, size of the corn in the cob matters so look for the bigger ones.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gallego

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down on time
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and cuts down on time. Only thing, if the Cobb is smaller you will have to push it through again to cut everything off.
customer_reviews.author: Kali Amato

customer_reviews.title: Works AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I have Invisalign and can’t eat corn from the cob very well. This thing works great! I’ve now ordered them for four friends after they’ve seen how it works!
customer_reviews.author: flyntiggr

customer_reviews.title: Nope..  Not useful as they claim.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this corn stripper thinking it will make my work easier. Sadly, it just doubled the work. The product looks handy, stylish, steady & easy to clean. The product could only strip the top half of the corn partially from the cob and needs to struggle to separate the remaining. The metal ring of the product is fixed size. It does not adjust to the size of the corn. A sharp, small knife does the job better.
customer_reviews.author: Kalaisri

customer_reviews.title: Not Convenient or easy to use 👎🏻
customer_reviews.text: very difficult to use without putting your hands all over the corn cob trying to push it thru. much much easier to just slice the kernals away from cob with a knife. this is NOT convenient at all 😡 if i could give zero stars i would 👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This thing is Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works way better than I expected. I stripped 8 ears of corn in no time flat. Kernels come off in whole pieces, much better than when using a knife where kernals get cut due to the flat of the knife. I highly recommend this gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Not the best way to get corn off the cob, but it workd
customer_reviews.text: A Knife would be quicker and easier, my teenage son thought it was a lot of fun though
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: A one size fits all product
customer_reviews.text: This device is a one size fits all type product. As you know, not all corn cobs are the same size. So if you get a slimmer cob, it leaves a lot behind. And if you get a thicker cob, it gets stuck. So, I have gone back to just cutting off the kernels with a serrated knife, which works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W. La Bay

customer_reviews.title: Overall helpful, difficult finish
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It works if the corn is the right size. That being said, it doesn't work well if the firm is too thin or thick of a piece. It is also hard to get to the bottom and get off without cutting yourself. But it does a good job in far less time than a knife!
customer_reviews.author: MJF Lime

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love....love....love this product. I make a lot of salads, dips and soups using corn and this is by far the best tool for removing the corn off the cob. I have brought it for 3 bridal showers and attached it to one of my corn recipes for the wishing well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy P

customer_reviews.title: Removed kernels with ease
customer_reviews.text: This is just as easy to use as the video shows. A few twists and the kernels are off the cob and in your bowl. Just canned 24 ears of corn using this and it was easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: Must have strong hands.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have the strength to make this work. Have it to goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: EX PAT.

customer_reviews.title: Size not flexible
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to get this product. We roadt lots of corn during season and my aging mother in law needs corn cut off Cobb. Well, its great if the corn is the perfect size. And since its not, I rated it a 4. I'd give it a 5 if it had a size flexibility. It is very easy to clean and works great if your corn fits easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Witter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money.i can cut it off faster and better with a knife
customer_reviews.author: fatmama1949

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just like anything, it’s not perfect but it does an awesome job! Just twist the corn cob inside and the kernels fall off. They don’t fly everywhere like other methods I’ve tried - they fly around some but not bad. For what it does, I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Ok but can be hard to get started.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as easy to use as I had hoped, might work better with the circular blade sharpened more. It would be nice to have handles or pegs to span a pan or bucket then just push the cob through and dig out the cobs from the corn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love making corn on the cob wrapped in bacon on the BBQ. Got a child with braces. Now he can enjoy. Boil the corn. Soak toothpicks in water. Let corn cool. Wrap bacon around corn and hold with toothpicks. Pepper bacon is amazing. If you only do half cob break in half away from you before boiling
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Don't work on small or large corn
customer_reviews.text: It does work but it need to be medium size corn
customer_reviews.author: Mommamixx

customer_reviews.title: Works great and so easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome! So easy to use and it works fast. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara H. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Just okay...
customer_reviews.text: Since not all cobbs are the same size - there is a lot of inconsistency with this product’s preformance. My parents had an extremely hard time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kessler Family

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use on any size ear of corn.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on "The Kitchen". My son doesn't like corn on the cob, but likes corn. Place a dish towel on the counter to catch the corn as it easily comes off the cob. Use on fresh corn by twisting as you push the corn through. Pull the last half. Buy corn in season and freeze for use later. Do not use on cooked corn on the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gadget for the job
customer_reviews.text: 6 grandkids with either missing front teeth or braces--this was the only way they could enjoy "hold 'e. corn". Strips the corn well off the cob. A little bit hard to use when the cobs were bigger, but did a great job, overall!
customer_reviews.author: ELizabeth Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly AWESOME product!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew that removing corn from the cob could be so easy. Earlier this week, I did 6 ears of corn in under 5 minutes. I just bought a bunch of farm stand corn to freeze for later, and I will make short work of them with this product. Everyone who makes fresh corn dishes should own one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Srtickland

customer_reviews.title: It freaking actually works
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get everything, but man shucking corn has never been easier some of them practically slide through. Would highly recommend if you eat a lot of fresh corn like my family does
customer_reviews.author: Negron-Santiago

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The tool did the job just fine, but they are difficult to on to.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: I could put myself through college with the stripping this thing does
customer_reviews.text: This little gem cleans every kernel off a cob in less than a minute. A little twisting, a little pulling and boom, a wad of corn!
customer_reviews.author: D. Benton

customer_reviews.title: Non functional and did not work.
customer_reviews.text: My hope was that this gadget would same time removing corn kernels but the metal cutter was not sharpe and the plastic and metal were made of cheap material. Used once and would gladly return it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: The Grief Guru

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Decent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. My only complaint is that there is always about a half inch of corn left on the cob. I have to use a (clean) bottle top or some other object to press through the last little bit.
customer_reviews.author: D Lind

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but needs a little work
customer_reviews.text: The corn stripper was east to use but often was not able to cut the bottom portion of the corn off the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Pearson

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this at first if it would work, but it really does. It was fantastic. It took a little longer and had to twist it to get corn but I'm super glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: NLR

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Most awkward corn peeler ever. I've tried several, but this one was no help...
customer_reviews.author: harpster4

customer_reviews.title: Nice, easy to use, but doesn't cut off the corn at the ends of the cobs.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice. Easy to use, but it doesn't cut off the corn at the ends of the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to get use too. Once you get comfortable with it, this tool works pretty well. I end up using a deep dish or food grade bucket. It can tend to get a little messy, but it is a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bg

customer_reviews.title: Corn cutter
customer_reviews.text: Only works good on uniform round ears of corn.. Shouldn’t have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype.....
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work on smaller ears of corn, as advertised. Certainly not worth the price and does not live up to the hype. Use a knife and save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit most ears of corn
customer_reviews.text: Must have very small ears of corn. I donated it, not even worth the drawer space.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose it was made for.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not size adjustable but works well on the average corn cob. You have to angle it and make a few passes on smaller cobs.
customer_reviews.author: Failtelorn

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: I used it a Lots, very convenient. But, my Mom prefers the old fashion way which is using the knife to cut the corns
customer_reviews.author: Mei

customer_reviews.title: look like they will work very good when summer gets
customer_reviews.text: look like they will work very good when summer gets here
customer_reviews.author: Happy cat Dad

customer_reviews.title: Not adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Not adjustable, so it rarely gets the right amount of corn off - too much or too little. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shine

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect gift for someone in my house that hates corn on the cob. The item works perfectly and clean the corn clean off the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Q

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this constantly. I love to add fresh corn to my salads and salsa. This takes the mess out of cutting corn off the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ellen

customer_reviews.title: A Must have
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect, my son has braces and it is a pain to cut the kernels off with a knife so I decided to give it a try. It is so simple and quick.... I'm mad that I didn't buy it sooner when my oldest had braces.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Fay

customer_reviews.title: A little too short for me, but a nice unit.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice unit. Does the job. I took off one star, because my hands are a little large for this unit, and it would be better for me if it were about an inch taller. I'm guessing that this was designed for a woman's smaller hand.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L

customer_reviews.title: little mesy, but not bad
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good... still a little messy, but not as bad as a knife. Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T.

customer_reviews.title: Needless to say this solved the problem and he is back to eating his favorite summer food
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves corn on the cob but hasn't been able to eat it lately because of some problems with his teeth. Needless to say this solved the problem and he is back to eating his favorite summer food.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was convinced this would not work. Flash forward to today when we decided to make cream corn. He’s a believer! No matter how big the corn cob, this device cleaned the kernels off the cob without squishing or breaking any kernels!
customer_reviews.author: Ann G.

customer_reviews.title: Gift so I don’t know!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to rate. It’s another Christmas gift, and hasn’t been used!
customer_reviews.author: charley erdman

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves corn on the cob but has a hard time eating it. This corn stripper is exactly what I’ve needed for years it works perfectly and is easy to use. Love it but purchase
customer_reviews.author: emmylikescupcakesa

product_meta.title: Chef'n Cob Corn Stripper (Yellow) -
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1With a simple twist of the Cob Corn Stripper by Chef'n, you can effortlessly remove corn from the cob to make your next summer salad or salsa quickly and easily. The stainless steel blades work hard to strip an entire cob in seconds. Simply place the corn cutter on top of the cob; in one twisting/pushing motion, you'll have fresh corn to add to any meal. This corn stripper is top rack dishwasher safe. Choose smart, easy-to-use kitchen utensils that are built on tasteful design, new technologies, and the trusted reputation of Chef'n.
feature_bullets: Easily remove corn from the cob in one quick twisting/pushing motion
Durable stainless steel blades effortlessly strip kernels in seconds
Quickly add corn to any meal, from homemade salsa to southwestern salads
